page.title: 03MARFORD MILL
page.content: The name Marford originates way back to the year 500 AD. It was first known as {Mereford}; the word{mere}meaning a boundary and the word{ford}meaning a crossing of a river_in this case the River Alyn. The township name of Mereford became shortened to Merford which eventually changed to Marford. Initially Marford had its own quern_a pestle and mortar type implement.This was housed in a building which is now known as Marford Mill. Each small township had its own water powered mill. For Marford it was Marford Mill. Marford Mill was built between 800 and 900 AD and then it was knocked down because the people of Marford wanted their own mill. In 1790 a famous painter named Turner painted a picture of the mill.
